title: emscripten asmjs calling emcc fails on windows because of incorrect quotation

labels.name: T-cargo
labels.description: Relevant to the cargo team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:

Extracted error to make it more readable:
> ERROR:root:a problem occurred in evaluating content after a "-s", specifically  EXPORTED_FUNCTIONS=[_main,_rust_eh_personality] . one possible cause of this is missing quotation marks (this depends on the shell you are running in; you may need quotation marks around the entire  EXPORTED_FUNCTIONS=[_main,_rust_eh_personality] , or on an individual element)

It calls `"cmd" "/c" "emcc.bat" ... "-s" "EXPORTED_FUNCTIONS=[\"_main\",\"_rust_eh_personality\"]" ...`.

It seems the quotation syntax is wrong. That quotation syntax works when calling emcc.bat directly, but not with `cmd /c`:
```
C:\code\emsdk\emscripten\incoming>"cmd" "/c" "emcc.bat" "-s" "EXPORTED_FUNCTIONS=[\"_main\"]" tests\hello_world.c -o a.html
ERROR:root:no input files
note that input files without a known suffix are ignored, make sure your input files end with one of: ('.c', '.C', '.i', '.cpp', '.cxx', '.cc', '.c++', '.CPP', '.CXX', '.CC', '.C++', '.ii', '.m', '.mi', '.mm', '.mii', '/dev/null', '.bc', '.o', '.obj', '.lo', '.dylib', '.so', '.a', '.ll', '.h', '.hxx', '.hpp', '.hh', '.H', '.HXX', '.HPP', '.HH')
```

But this works:
```
> "cmd" "/c" "emcc.bat" "-s" "EXPORTED_FUNCTIONS=['_main']" "tests\hello_world.c" "-o" "a.html"
```
and this:
```
> cmd /c emcc.bat -s EXPORTED_FUNCTIONS=['_main'] tests\hello_world.c -o a.html
```

So [this function](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/41e03c3c469d1c89735fa518a9af4eb3df8b0728/src/librustc_trans/back/linker.rs#L716) would have to be changed to use this format, right?

So the correct way to call it would be:
```
`"cmd" "/c" "emcc.bat" ... "-s" "EXPORTED_FUNCTIONS=['_main','_rust_eh_personality']" ...`
```
like recommended [here](https://kripken.github.io/emscripten-site/docs/getting_started/FAQ.html#why-do-functions-in-my-c-c-source-code-vanish-when-i-compile-to-javascript-and-or-i-get-no-functions-to-process)?
